definitions.example: He rotated in his chair to face me.

definitions.definition: To advance through a sequence; to take turns.
definitions.example: The nurses' shifts rotate each week.

definitions.definition: (of aircraft) To lift the nose, just prior to takeoff.
definitions.example: The aircraft rotates at sixty knots.

definitions.definition: To spin, turn, or revolve something.
definitions.example: Rotate the dial to the left.

definitions.definition: To advance something through a sequence; to allocate or deploy in turns.
To replace older materials or to place older materials in front of newer ones so that older ones get used first.
definitions.example: The supermarket rotates the stock daily so that old foods don't sit around.

definitions.definition: To grow or plant (crops) in a certain order.
That proceeds in sequence or in turns
